episode_summary: This episode of No Such Thing As A Fish, recorded live at the Soho Theatre, features guest presenter Ella Al-Shamahi. The hosts discuss a variety of topics including the emotional expressions of whales, Campbell's soup cocktails, cosmic rays affecting elections, and a record-breaking underwater living experiment.

facts.fact: I feel like I must have at some point cried in the ocean and I've felt a bit better for it, you know. That's true, you can see you crying in the ocean is the point, right?
In the 1950s, Campbell's tried to persuade people to start drinking cocktails made out of beef soup.
In 2003, there were 4,096 fraudulent votes in the Belgian election. The culprit, it was later discovered, was the universe.
The man who just broke the world record for living underwater got a visit from his 80-year-old mother halfway through to keep him cheerful.
